oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Save money, put goodyear tires on your small car
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: An advertisement for Goodyear tires from the 1920s. The advertisement shows the prices of all weather tread tires and anti-skid tires.

In the 1920s, people witnessed the popularity of the automobile. One of the entrepreneurs that helped spur the growth of the automobile industry was Henry Ford who was based in Dearborn, Michigan. With his assembly line production of developing cars, he helped meet the demand for people who were eager to have a car. Ford's most popular brand during this time was the Model T car also known as the "Tin Lizzie". The popularity of the automobile created new demands for car parts such as tires and glass.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Advertising; Automobiles; Tires
